item.title: Manhole sound incredibly loud when cars and buses drive over, 8th February
item.description:
I've lived here for 3 years and have only noticed it being extra loud in the last month or so - when vehicles driving toward surrey quays go over the manhole it makes a loud clanging noise which is especially noticeable at night amongst the silence. I'm four floors up and it is REALLY loud under buses and heavier vehicles.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Surrey Quays Road, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping garbage bags, 8th February
item.description:
There are not enough waste bins here. These bins are constantly overflowing with garbage on the street. With foxes and cats in the area this is a health and safety hazard for them and for people living in the area. Other bags also left outside garages regularly as shown in the photos

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Yalding Road, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: South west corner of Leighton Road and Brecknock Road, 8th February
item.description:
There is a hole in the pavement with two squares of tactile paving in the hole. The tactile paving is not secure and is a trip hazard. People using a stick will have trouble finding a secure area to place their stick. The location is in the London Borough of Camden.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 186, Leighton Road, Tufnell Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
